result.execSummary:
The defendant Joni E Dashner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations. 
 Defendant is granted credit for 12 days time served as calculated by the Ashland County Sheriff's Department

miscConds.notes: Defendant is placed on a payment plan of $25 per month beginning 12/1/16.

Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.  
  The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..  
The Def is subject to random UA testing.
Comply with all rules, terms and conditions of the drug court program and successfully complete the program. 
NO CONTACT WITH ASHLAND WALMART
NO CONTACT WITH JORDON BELL 
NO ASSOCIATION WITH ANY KNOWN METHAMPHETAMINE USERS, DEALERS OR THOSE IN ANY WAY ASSOCIAT EWITH METHAMPHETAMINE EXCEPT AS NECESSARY FOR CORRECTIONAL CONFINEMENTS AND GROUP TREATMENT/ COUNSELING.   The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.
Restitution to WalMart in the amount of $106.22

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joni E Dashner in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CF236,15CM267-- 15CM267-- placed in Drug Court- DA filed motion to terminate.. Motion to terminate in 16CF236.16CF59-- Atty comments thought they took care of cases in the last hearing.. She is terminated from the drug court-- DA comments 16CF59 240 days as  condition of, must serve 60 and 180 stayed for drug court-- the stay will lift and will serve 180 days as a condition of probation, and case 16CF36-- 150 days as a conditions stayed that stay will lift they are concurrent.. JOCS must be amended that def was discharges  from DC and conditional jail time that was stayed is now ordered. 17CF122-- offer to settle is the agreement of parties. Not to run the jail time concurrent- agreement of the parties. Understands charge and potential penalties . PLEADS NC.. DA comments no waive of prelim. plea withdrawn-- advised of rights to prelim, knows rights to prelim, no threat or force to give up right to prelim, know and vol waived right to prelim, Ct finds prob cause def committed Fel in Ashland CO, bound over for argnment, DA filed a info, Atty comments rec'd info. Understands charge and potential penalties . PLEAD NC, admits she is a repeater. Signed PQ. no Mind altering Substances, Understands elements of the crime. Wants Ct to accept pleas.. Ct accepts pleas and finds G. DA comments -- Prior record- does remain on probation.. Thinks probation is appt. Thinks agreement is appt. Atty comments-- Could be facing a lot more time. Def comments want to apologies to the court and her family. CT orders-- withheld 3 years probation.. Conditions 180 days jail start immed after the conmditional jail time in 59 and 236.. work release, child care release, this jail time only grants good time, AODA, follow through, absol, no presence, UA, no Drug user contact, Cogntive therapy, other counseling, DNA, $10 fine and costs 577.55, any contraband seized ordered forf, payplan sent current-- next payment 1/2/18.. seek work and obtain mantain partime employment. Atty comments- asking for huber is she can work.. granted

Attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer in court.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Doesnt believe the Def needs to be here in person. Working on resolution, asks for another status 30-45 days. DA comments motion to terminate drug court pending. Motion to terminate Drug Court 16CF236. Def to appr in person
  Status conference scheduled for July 17, 2017 at 11:30 am.
